page.title: 14Stackpole School
page.content: Stackpole has the only primary school in the area.Its pupils come from far afield,the villages it serves are Castlemartin, Bosherston, St. Twynnell's, Merrion, Maidenwells, the Merrion Army Camp and Stackpole itself. Some children come from Pembroke. Most children come to school by bus. The school has a nursery department and the majority of children begin at the school the term after their third birthday. The school has a teaching headmaster and three class teachers. Also employed are a nursery assistant, an ancillary assistant in charge of a deaf child and a Welsh peripatetic teacher who teaches her subject as a second language on four half days a week. There are no native Welsh speaking children in the area.
